author: ngelzzz

text: Bubble #6 tl/n: Teru Teru Bozu is a paper doll that is hanged when you want to wish for a certain weather. When it is hanged normally, it means you are wishing for it not to rain. Hanged upside down, it means you are hoping for more rain.
author: ngelzzz

text: Tl/n: Meshi means food/meals. Itameshi is a combination of Italia and meshi.
author: ngelzzz

text: Tl/n: Meshi means food/meals. Itameshi is a combination of Italia and meshi. As for the French food, the kanji for France would be 仏蘭西. Following the logic of Itameshi, it takes the first kanji from France, which by itself means Buddha, hence Buddha Rice.
author: ngelzzz

text: Tl/n: Meshi means food/meals. Itameshi is a combination of Italia and meshi. As for the French food, the kanji for France would be 仏蘭西. Following the logic of Itameshi, it takes the first kanji from France, which by itself would mean France or Buddha, hence Buddha Rice.
author: ngelzzz

text: Tl/n: Meshi means food. Itameshi is a combination of Italia and meshi. As for the French food, the kanji for France would be 仏蘭西. Following the logic of Itameshi, it takes the first kanji from France, which by itself could still mean France, but it could also mean Buddha.
author: ngelzzz

text: Bubble #10: The fortune reading is basically done
author: ngelzzz

text: Bubble #10 extras: The fortune reading is the type based on the zodiacs. Each day the 12 zodiacs will be ranked with top place having great luck for the day, while the bottom place has the worst luck. This ranking changes every day, and people usually look at it in the morning before doing their activities. (a japan thing)
author: ngelzzz

text:
Briefs are obviously the opposite of boxers, which is more akin to short pants. The problem with briefs is because Japanese body measurements usually mean everybody will be lining up with only their underwear on. Girls are given more privacy while boys are usually more all you can see (they would be lined up in the hallway, etc). So I guess it would be more embarrassing for the boys who usually wear briefs to be seen XD. 
source: blog from Japanese dude who shared his bad memories of the body measurement day.
author: ngelzzz

text:
Kakipi --> name of snack

発見 --> Discovery

Tsumeshogi or tsume is the Japanese term for a shogi problem in which the goal is to checkmate the opponent's King. Tsume problems present a situation that might occur in a shogi game, and the solver must find out how to achieve checkmate. It is similar to a chess problem.

text: Nagara is holding a book titled "Gongitsune / Gon the fox" which tells the story of
author: ngelzzz

text: Nagara is holding a book titled "Gongitsune / Gon the fox" which tells the story of how a fox stole an eel that a man wanted to give to his sickly mother, which his mother died quickly afterwards after this. Gon realized he made a mistake and tried make up for it by giving the man stuff, but then the man got accused of stealing and got beat up. Gon gave the man mushrooms and nuts he collected after he got beat up which he was grateful for, but he didn't know where the gifts kept coming from. One day, the man saw the fox, and shot him out of anger from his mother's death. Little did he know, that fox was the one who gave him the gifts.
author: ngelzzz

text:
Futomaki --> thick rolls. Ehomaki --> the rolls you specifically eat during setsubun.

Basically futomaki can be any roll that's thick
author: ngelzzz
